page.title: 14 BUILDINGS ON OSEA ISLAND.
page.content: There are 14 houses on the island.Two are C17th,nine are early C20th and the remainder were built between 1916 and 1926.At one time they were used to house Alcoholics whom Mr. Carrington hoped to wean off drink. The scheme was not a total success as some of the inmates managed to arrange secret deliveries by boat. During the First World War the Navy took over the island and several of the buildings go back to that time. A former ammunition shed is now a grainstore; an old Nissan hut is now a boatshed; the old Generating House is now a workshop and the old gymnasium is a shed. The Navy also left behind a Chapel but noone would now recognise it as such. A more recent farm building is the grainstore built in the 1960's.
